roleset.name: extract (ore or minerals) from the earth
roleset.note: MINE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'mine' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from mine.01-v predicate notes)
MINING-N NOTES: Updated by Julia based on mine-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls mine-10.9, hunt-35.1. (from mining.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Gold-oriented funds , for instance , which [*T*-1] invest in companies that [*T*-2]mine and process the precious metal , posted an average decline of 1.15 % .

example.name: no subject antecedent
example.text: Westmoreland 's strategy is [*] to retain and expand its core business of [*]mining and selling low-sulphur coal in the Appalachia region .

example.name: arg1 and LOC
example.text: Early this century , diamond mining in the magnificent dunes where the Namib Desert meets the Atlantic Ocean was a day at the beac
example.arg: in the magnificent dunes where the Namib Desert meets the Atlantic Ocean

example.name: arg0 and LOC
example.text: Their mining of the entrances to the Norwegian Sea,
example.arg: of the entrances to the Norwegian Sea

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Paradoxically, they considered platinum as a nuisance for their mining of gold.
